alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 2:45PM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Mainly snow with a light wintry mix possible. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Kansas, Smith and Jewell Counties. In Nebraska, Fillmore, Nuckolls and Thayer Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Falling temperatures and light to moderate snow rates will lead to hazardous travel conditions that will worsen through the afternoon and evening. Lingering travel impacts into Thursday morning are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow rates will occur through early this evening. However, as snowfall decreases, northwest winds will increase and gust up to 30 to 35 MPH. This will lead to areas of blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
